The lambs need more than daily food. They look to the shepherd for protection. They need watchcare, and are to be as tenderly guarded as the mother guards her child. If one goes astray, it must be faithfully 


                                     -397- 

searched for until it is restored to the fold. The figure is a beautiful one, and well represents the faithful, loving service that the under-shepherd of the flock of Christ is to give to those under his protection and care.--Letter 6, 1909. 









Ellen G. White Estate 
Silver Spring, Maryland 
April 12, 1990. Entire Letter.
